Detailed Description

Interface to the hardware Free Pool Allocator.

static cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t cvmx_fpa1_pool_to_fpa3_aura ( cvmx_fpa1_pool_t  pool  )  [inline, static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Convert FPA1 style POOL into FPA3 AURA in backward compatibility mode.

static void* cvmx_fpa_alloc ( uint64_t  pool  )  [inline, static]

Get a new block from the FPA.

Parameters:
pool Pool to get the block from
Returns:
Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
static void cvmx_fpa_async_alloc ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
uint64_t  pool 
) [inline, static]

Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA.

The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().

Parameters:
scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in. This is a byte address but must be 8 byte aligned.
pool Pool to get the block from
static void* cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
uint64_t  pool 
) [inline, static]

Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.

Parameters:
scr_addr The Local scratch address. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
pool Pool the block came from. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
Returns:
Pointer to the block or NULL on failure

Disable the FPA.

Enable the FPA.

static void cvmx_fpa_free ( void *  ptr,
uint64_t  pool,
uint64_t  num_cache_lines 
) [inline, static]

Free a block allocated with a FPA pool.

Provides required memory ordering in cases where memory block was modified by core.

Parameters:
ptr Block to free
pool Pool to put it in
num_cache_lines Cache lines to invalidate
static void cvmx_fpa_free_nosync ( void *  ptr,
uint64_t  pool,
uint64_t  num_cache_lines 
) [inline, static]

Free a block allocated with a FPA pool.

Does NOT provide memory ordering in cases where the memory block was modified by the core.

Parameters:
ptr Block to free
pool Pool to put it in
num_cache_lines Cache lines to invalidate

Gets the block size of buffer in specified pool.

pool is the pool number

This function will work with CN78XX models in backward-compatible mode

int cvmx_fpa_global_init_node ( int  node  ) 

Initialize FPA per node.

Initialize FPA per node.

Parameters:
node is the node number
Note:
this function sets the initial QoS averaging timing parameters, for the entire FPA unit (per node), which may be overriden on a per AURA basis.

int cvmx_fpa_is_pool_available ( int  pool_num  ) 

Return if aura/pool is already reserved.

Parameters:
pool_num - pool to check (aura for o78+)
Returns:
0 if reserved, 1 if available
Note:
This function is no longer in use, and will be removed in a future release
int cvmx_fpa_setup_pool ( int  pool,
const char *  name,
void *  buffer,
uint64_t  block_size,
uint64_t  num_blocks 
)

Setup a FPA pool to control a new block of memory.

This can only be called once per pool. Make sure proper locking enforces this.

Parameters:
pool Pool to initialize
name Constant character string to name this pool. String is not copied.
buffer Pointer to the block of memory to use. This must be accessable by all processors and external hardware.
block_size Size for each block controlled by the FPA
num_blocks Number of blocks
Returns:
the pool number on Success, -1 on failure

Setup a FPA pool to control a new block of memory.

Parameters:
pool is the POOL number desired or -1 for automatic assignment
name is the symbolic POOL name
buffer is an optionally caller-supplied memory for the buffers or NULL to cause the buffer memory to be allocated automatically.
block_size is the size of all buffers held in this POOL
num_blocks is the number of free buffers to fill into the POOL
buffer is an optionally caller-supplied memory for the buffers or NULL to cause the buffer memory to be allocated automatically.
Returns:
pool number or -1 on error.

Note: if the buffer memory is supplied by caller, the application will be responsable to free this memory. This function will work with CN78XX models in backward-compatible mode

int cvmx_fpa_shutdown_pool ( int  pool  ) 

Shutdown a Memory pool and validate that it had all of the buffers originally placed in it.

This should only be called by one processor after all hardware has finished using the pool. Most like you will want to have called cvmx_helper_shutdown_packet_io_global() before this function to make sure all FPA buffers are out of the packet IO hardware.

Parameters:
pool Pool to shutdown
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error

This function will work with CN78XX models in backward-compatible mode

int cvmx_fpa_validate_pool ( int  pool  ) 

Perform a sanity check on a specific FPA pool.

NOTE: Although this is a generic API, it is only implemented on CN78XX version of FPA.

Returns 0 on success, -1 if any internal errors are encountered
